GLOSS: African eggplant (similar to tomato) in two varieties
earth (as brick mix or to repair walls)
go to sleep, fall asleep, sleep
grind up, crush well (e.g. millet grains, for millet cakes) with grindstones
reciprocally, each other (more than two humans)
small calabash with protrusions on side (for milk)
sweet sorghum (stalk chewed like sugar cane)
tie, tie up (sth or sb, with a rope)
